data.event: The area is now maintained as Providence Metropark of Toledo, featuring numerous elements of the canal era, including a mule-drawn canal boat on a restored section of the Miami and Erie Canal, and an operating saw and gristmill.
He arrived there in 1816 in order to establish a fur trading post for the North West Fur Company, then based in Montreal, Canada.
In 1822, Manor had a sawmill erected next to the river, and a gristmill was built in 1835.
